AuditDetail:
Sampling procedure for water is documented  SSOP-1 
Source of water borewell,- Soda dozing- Multi grade filter – Softener – chlorine dozer – over head tank – UV-  supplied to processing.
Water and Ice is tested from external laboratory as per EIA guidelines against 98/83/EC. Frequencies are two yearly full parameters and six monthly as per clause 1 of table A of annexure II of directive 98/83.EC as specified at annexure 35 page 276.  
Test report verified for two yearly parameters for water & Ice, report number KO 116107/2016 & KO 116108/2016 respectively, and dated 28/04/2016, KO 116432/2016 dated 02/05/2016 and KO 132839/2016 & KO 132889/2016 dated 26/12/2016 respectively. 
Test report is verified for six monthly frequencies,  report No. BLR/F(C/M)/18/000864 dated 22/01/2018 verified for six monthly parameters. 
Residual chlorine of process water is tested every one hour report was seen dated 28/02/2017 reported as < 2 ppm in FMT/SSOP/033
Steam water is tested as per 10500: 2012 , Test Report KO  136686/2017 dated 07/04/2017; KO 136742/2017 & KO 136741/2017 dated 10/04/2017 verified. 
Water and ice is tested in-house laboratory for TPC at 22 Degree C (acceptable limit100 cfu/ml,) -
and  37 degree C, (acceptable limit 20 cfu/ml) Coliform, V. cholerae (nil), Salmonella (nil) report verified dated  17.02.2017, (testing frequency is daily)
Up to date plumbing diagram is available. Last updated on 09.01.2017.   No Air/Gas is used in the process.                          The process water test report (Microbiology parameters) does not comply with BAP annexure 6. 
The facility has tested the process water as per the frequency stated in BAP standard annex-6; i.e. once in six month and test report no. - BLR/F(C/M)/18/000864 dated 22/01/2018 is verified.
However, the Microbiology Parameter E. coli was tested per 100 ml sample but as per the standard requirement E. coli shall be tested per 250 ml sample.
LongName: Water used in food production areas shall be checked at least every six months by an accredited independent third party laboratory for microbial and chemical contamination as described in Annex 6.
Question: Water used in food production areas shall be checked at least every six months by an accredited independent third party laboratory for microbial and chemical contamination as described in Annex 6.
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail:

Facility has conducted the safety training among the staff & workers. Training Record was verified.
However, the list of trained workers was not pasted in different location at the factory for better access during emergency.

AuditDetail:
"Details: Range of products processed is covered in Doc: HACCP Manual duly authorized by Managing Partner Mr. Prabha Ranjan Patnaik.                                              Facility developed their HACCP in line with Codex Alimentarius and Fish & Fishery Products; Hazards and Control guidance FOURTH Edition - April 2011 and same is stated as declaration. Same also verified while reviewing the HACCP documents as follows. 
HACCP study is done for product group  - Raw Block Frozen - HACCP/012; Rev. - 03 dated 23/02/2018; & Raw IQF shrimp - HACCP/021; Rev. - 03 dated 23/02/2018;,  Cooked IQF - HACCP/030; Rev. - 03 dated 23/02/2018.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   HACCP Plan is documented for product group  - Raw Block Frozen - HACCP/017; Rev. - 03 dated 23/02/2018; & Raw IQF shrimp - HACCP/026; Rev. - 03 dated 23/02/2018;,  Cooked IQF - HACCP/035; Rev. - 03 dated 23/02/2018."
However, Hazard Analysis worksheet does not include hazards associated with Heavy metal for primary packing materials; 
Although, adequate SOP available to control the hazard.
LongName: The HACCP plan and hazard analysis shall include, at minimum, at least those hazards identified by Codex Alimentarius, or the USFDA's Fish and Fisheries Products Hazards and Controls Guide (aka FDA Hazards and Controls Guide), Fourth Edition, April 2011, or both. Depending upon the country of operation and where product is exported to.  Where local or export country(ies) requirements are stricter, those requirements shall prevail.  In the absence of specific legislation or guidance for local or export country(ies), the hazards defined in the aforementioned FDA Hazards and Controls Guide shall become the default position that all applicants shall comply with.

Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail:
Pest Control procedure is defined in GMP/ /010 & SSOP/014; Rev. - 03 dated 23/02/2018. Preventive pest control system has been designed with air curtains, strip curtains, self closing doors, grates on drains and sealed windows. 
The company had outsourced pest activity to “Innovative Pest control” Contract for the same was evident (spider, fly, mosquito, rodent, lizard control and disinfection), valid up to 08/03/2019. Contractor’s licence no CPCO/24181/2017/0006/N (Mr. B. V. J. Bhaskar) valid up to 31/12/2018. Trade License from local Panchayat is also available vide reference IPC-1/16 vide receipt - 0085. Only approved chemicals are used. One person has been deputed on daily basis to conduct pest control services, training record available, letter dated 31/01/2018 for Mr. Akthar Ali. 
Pest control schedule has been prepared, Daily, weekly and monthly. Pest control records are maintained. 32 Redent traps are placed inside the premices. 
Records seen - Fly Control Daily Activity Report, Mosquito Control Report in FMEL/SSOP/030, Spider Control record in FMEL/SOP/331, Lizard control record in FMT/SOP/332, Disinfestation Activities report in FMT/SOP/333, Rodent Control Record in FMEL/SSOP/029 during the period of Jan to May 2018. Bait stations for rodent control was found properly maintained as per map documented . Covers rodent traps with glue pad, and mechanical cage are in use.
Trend analysis is documented under - FMEL/SSOP/121 & FMEL/SSOP/122.
Electric fly killers were adequately places so as not to infect other products. 
Service provider conducted the Audit on 20/02/2018.     Facility has maintained an effective pest control program to prevents, controls and eliminates risk of pest infestation at inside the facility and on facility grounds. Agreement with Innovative Pest Control was evident during the day of audit.
However, while site visit it was found that two birds were freely moving near the Raw Materials receiving chute, chances for pest infestation inside the facility.
Although, receiving chute was closed and raw materials receiving activity was completed.
LongName: The facility shall have in place an effective pest control program/system that prevents, controls and eliminates risk of pest infestation and harborage areas inside the facility and on facility grounds.  Pest control shall be performed by either a licensed third party or a properly trained personnel within the facility.
Question: The facility shall have in place an effective pest control program/system that prevents, controls and eliminates risk of pest infestation and harborage areas inside the facility and on facility grounds.  Pest control shall be performed by either a license

AuditDetail:
Details in clause - BAP Anex 4/1.2
Adequate farm data for all farm deliveries received from BAP non-certified farm suppliers were not included in the farmer Audit report conducted by the facility.
For one instant case while traceability study reviewing, the quantity of raw materials received under one lot production does not match with the production capacity of harvested pond referred in the SOP. 
Although the facility is BAP one star certified, hence severity of deviation is less.
LongName:
Farm supplies - Facilities shall maintain documented Farm Data for all farm deliveries received from all BAP certified and non-certified farm suppliers to include the below information, as applicable:
  o Farm supplier name  o BAP farm certification number  o Production method (pond, cages, reservoir, etc.)  o Identification of production unit  o Sources of post larvae/stocking material  o Date of deliveries and lot numbers (one pond or culture unit on a single day)  o Unit of measure and total net weight for mass balance  o Movement document number (if relevant)  o Feed use (type and lot numbers)  o Reports of chemical treatments  o Testing data for the presence of microbes, antibiotics and chemicals in product

AuditDetail: The facility have serious incident management which cover hoe product integrity, worker safety and key facility operations will be maintained. However, the document procedure do not a description of how the business continuity will be maintained in the event of a serious incident. Incident Management Control procedure (PC-SE-005 revision 1.1 date 15 August 2017) details cover how product integrity, worker safety and key facility operations will be maintained. The product safety was manage by Control of Nonconformity Product Procedure. The incident records clearly shown the detail of handling methods as well as preventive actions to prevent reoccurance of the serious incident.
LongName: The plan shall also include a description of how the business continuity will be maintained in the event of a serious incident. This shall cover at a minimum how product integrity, worker safety, and key facility operations will be maintained.

The labeling of the star status of products are detailed in the Traceability system and document support work instruction (WI-QA-022 revision 1.9 date 17 April 2018).
LongName: The label control procedure referred to in 7.1.2 shall include a procedure for the proper labelling and downgrading of the star status of products in the event the facility mixes product of different BAP star categories. Where this occurs, records shall be maintained demonstrating which products of different BAP star categories were mixed, and that the star status of resultant product was properly downgraded. (Example: If 3 star BAP products are mixed with 2 star BAP products, then the entire product lot must be labelled as 2 star BAP product. The 3 star BAP products will lose its 3 star status.  Where 1 and 2 star products are mixed, or 1, 2 and 3 star products are mixed, the entire product lot shall be downgraded to 1 star).
Question: The label control procedure referred to in 7.1.2 shall include a procedure for the proper labelling and downgrading of the star status of products in the event the facility mixes product of different BAP star categories. Where this occurs, records shall b
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail: The facility do not have a unique code or lot number separately for products of each BAP star category. Traceability system and document support work instruction (WI-QA-022 revision 1.9 date 17 April 2018).and Traceability Procedure (PC-MK-005 revision 1.5 date 17 April 2018) defined how to separate products of each BAP star category. The R/M lot code is used as traceability purpose from the receiving of raw materials and carry forward through each step of production to the finished products. The R/M lot code is part of finished products code agreed by all buyers.
LongName: The facility shall assign a unique code or lot number separately for products of each BAP star category. This unique code or lot number shall be assigned at receiving and carry forward through each step of production, packaging and storage in order to easily identify and trace every lot of BAP 1, 2, 3 and 4 star products from each other, and from non-BAP products.
Question: The facility shall assign a unique code or lot number separately for products of each BAP star category. This unique code or lot number shall be assigned at receiving and carry forward through each step of production, packaging and storage in order to eas
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail: The facility have retention sample of each primary product form for every month. However, the facility collected only 1 lot per primary product form. The facility retained at least 1 frozen samples for each primary product form for every month that they are in production. Each sample is collected as minimum 1 inner bag for each primary product produced for every month which is equal to or more than 113 grams. During the audit, the auditor observed storage section in cold storage for retention sample. Based on the document reviews, sample retention plan for 2017, the oldest lots for each primary product form was stored for more than 1 year from the time that each lot was shipped.
LongName: The facility shall retain frozen samples of 3 lots for each primary product form (see Annex 1 Glossary for the definition of """"""""Primary Product Form"""""""") for every month they are in production.   A sample is defined as a minimum of 4 ounces (113 grams).  Samples shall be stored for one year from the time the lot is shipped.  After one year the samples can be disposed of.
Question: The facility shall retain frozen samples of 3 lots for each primary product form (see Annex 1 Glossary for the definition of "Primary Product Form") for every month they are in production.   A sample is defined as a minimum of 4 ounces (113 grams).
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail:
Facility maintains the roof of food production area as per the BAP requirement. Roof of chill room in processing hall found no leakage and rusted.                                                                                                                                                                             However, Facility does not maintain the roof of Packaging materials area as per the BAP requirement. 
Roof of Packaging materials hall where Cartoon, polythene and dry chemicals are stored, found some rusted and dirty. 
There are potential chances of cross contamination observed.
LongName: The roofs of food production, food packaging, ingredients and chemical storage areas shall be maintained.  There shall be no evidence of leaks, mold, rust or flaking paint.
Question: The roofs of food production, food packaging, ingredients and chemical storage areas shall be maintained.  There shall be no evidence of leaks, mold, rust or flaking paint.
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail:
Tables & Freezer Belts handling finished products are in good condition.  Checked the table tops and corners and utensils surfaces are smooth without any aberration. Undergo routine cleaning and sanitizing and also periodic maintenance.                                                    
However, While site visit it was noticed that some cracked plastic bins were using at the production hall.
LongName: All food contact surfaces, including equipment and utensils, shall be in good condition and free of cracks, pits, gouging and abraded areas.
Question: All food contact surfaces, including equipment and utensils, shall be in good condition and free of cracks, pits, gouging and abraded areas.
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail:
The process water test report (Microbiology parameters) does not comply with BAP annexure 6. 
The facility has tested the process water as per the frequency stated in BAP standard annex-6; i.e. once in six month and test report no. - KO 134202/2017 dt. 21/01/2017 is verified.
However, the Microbiology parameter E. coli was tested per 100 ml sample but as per the standard requirement E.coli should be tested per 250 ml sample.
LongName: Water used in food production areas shall be checked at least every six months by an accredited independent third party laboratory for microbial and chemical contamination as described in Annex 6.
Question: Water used in food production areas shall be checked at least every six months by an accredited independent third party laboratory for microbial and chemical contamination as described in Annex 6.
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail:
The facility has not made proper segregation between food production and non-food production area in between Pre-processing and offal (Shell waste) room.  
Improper Floor design was noticed in between Pre-processing area and offal room where chances of cross contamination during deep cleaning at offal room, dirty water may enter in pre-processing room.
At high Risk packing area, one small open chute was noticed from where the packed cartoons are passing after metal detection to anteroom. 
There are chances for potential source of cross contamination.
LongName: The Facility premises, equipment, and flow shall be designed, constructed and maintained to prevent the risk of contamination or cross-contamination to food and food contact surfaces and ingredients. .
Question: The Facility premises, equipment, and flow shall be designed, constructed and maintained to prevent the risk of contamination or cross-contamination to food and food contact surfaces and ingredients. .

However, the records for thermometers calibration were not adequately documented as part of demonstration.

The schedule shall identify each item, calibration date, scheduled frequency, method or standard calibrated to, and the party that performed the calibration.

Presently the facility is certified for BAP FOUR Star categories.

Although the facility is used BAP Three Star logo on their products for one consignment.

However, the Risk Assessment does not include the safety hazards for worker who are engaging for printing of Label by using the INK (Brand – JP K67 & TH TYPE A from Japan) manufactured by Hitachi, which is harmful for eye & skin irritation, but no precautionary instruction and PPEs (gloves and goggles) were provided to them as safety measure.

Facility is not ensuring the machinery is adequately safeguarded at Raw IQF section.

Although the height was sufficient enough to avoid any health safety risk to the workers.

No condensation observed in the plant either in production area, in packaging area etc. Arrangement of air circulation and ventilation was found proper. Dev: In Cooking area condensation was found at one corner, likewise in the ante room area condensation was found.

AuditDetail:
The first reviewed mock recall performed on 26 January 2017 during 13:00 - 16:56 for the first specific customer for PTOI-VN-COSF-WHC size 31/40. The mock situation indicated as "salt supplier informed there are foreign material contaminate in lot 1701121L1A". The summary report showed that the facility was able to trace that the salt lot is used for 3 production code of that specific customer (i.e. code 66A/18TA/216, 66A/18TA/218, and 66A/18TA/227) that produced on 18 January 2017. The products of this mock recall are claimed as 4 star BAP product (related to F10593, H10025, and M10004). The facility did not cover all product affected from this salt lot which might include other customers.

 Mock recall program (S-02-B-062, revision 10, date 10 October 2017) indicated that 'mock recall' is conducted at least once a year to cover forward and backward. The facility performed mock recall about 9 times a year as plan updated on 1 March 2017 according to the specific customer requirements. The auditor reviewed 5 mock recall reports for 4 specific customers: The second reviewed mock recall performed during 7:00 - 10:55 for the first specific customer for CPDTO41/55 code 66A/05WA/086 produced on 5 July 2017 from raw material batch 086. The mock situation indicated as "Customer complaint that found Salmonella spp. in the finished product lot". The summary report showed that the facility was able to trace 100% (444 cartons for this lot). The products of this mock recall are claimed as 4 star BAP product (related to F10146, H10025, and M10004). The third reviewed mock recall performed on 24 May 2017 during 17:03 - 18.51 for CPND-IQF size 61/80 manufactured on 24 November 2016 from raw material batch 518 for the second specific customer. The mock situation indicated as "Customer complaint that found rusty like contaminated in 4 cartons of this product lot". The summary report showed the facility count trace 100% (344 cartons for this lot). The products did not claim BAP product. The fourth and fifth reviewed mock recalls performed in 2016 for the third and fourth specific customers. The mock situation for both mock recalls indicated as "Customer complaint that found foreign material (i.e. plastic pieces and metal) in the finished product lot". The summary reports of both mock recall showed that the facility was able to trace the products 100% and could be done within 4 hours. The summary report also indicated communication time (both internal team and related parties) after exercise.
LongName: The recall plan shall be tested at a minimum, annually through a mock recall test.  The results of the test shall be documented.   The results shall identify, at a minimum:   the mock incident, identification of all product affected and where it was shipped, how customers that received it were (or would have been) notified, and what percentage of product was successfully identified to be recalled.  Each test show also state how long the  mock recall took.
Question: The recall plan shall be tested at a minimum, annually through a mock recall test.  The results of the test shall be documented.   The results shall identify, at a minimum:   the mock incident, identification of all product affected and wh
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail:
Due to the facility processed (sushi) products packed in vacuum pack, but the facility did not concern the hazard of C. botulinum as USFDA's "Fish and Fisheries Products Hazards ad Control Guide", Fourth Edition, April 2011. 

 During the audit, the auditor reviewed 6 chapters of the HACCP manual as below: 1) Chapter 3.4, date 5 May 2017 for frozen raw skewer shrimp 2) Chapter 5.1, date 5 May 2017 for frozen cooked shrimp 3) Chapter 5.5, date 5 May 2017 for frozen headless boiled peeled and un-peeled and belly cut tail on shrimp (sushi) 4) Chapter 7.1, date 5 May 2017 for frozen breaded shrimp 5) Chapter 11.1, date 27 November 2017 for frozen pre-fried breaded shrimp 6) Chapter 11.3, date 16 November 2017 for fried shrimp cheek with seasoning (snack) Based on the reviewed chapters of the current HACCP manual, they include most of the hazards identified by Codex Alimentarius and all food safety standards and legislation of domestic and exported countries (e.g. EU, USA, Japan, Australia / New Zealand, Korea, and Russia.
LongName: The HACCP plan and hazard analysis shall include, at minimum, at least those hazards identified by Codex Alimentarius, or the USFDA's Fish and Fisheries Products Hazards and Controls Guide (aka FDA Hazards and Controls Guide), Fourth Edition, April 2011, or both. Depending upon the country of operation and where product is exported to.  Where local or export country(ies) requirements are stricter, those requirements shall prevail.  In the absence of specific legislation or guidance for local or export country(ies), the hazards defined in the aforementioned FDA Hazards and Controls Guide shall become the default position that all applicants shall comply with.
Question: The HACCP plan and hazard analysis shall include, at minimum, at least those hazards identified by Codex Alimentarius, or the USFDA's Fish and Fisheries Products Hazards and Controls Guide (aka FDA Hazards and Controls Guide), Fourth Editi
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

AuditDetail:
The HACCP plan for Fried Shrimp Cheek with Seasoning (Snack) (H-02-A-001), Chapter 11.3, Date 16 November 2017 indicated one of the critical limits for baking as "Aw (water activity) < 0.6" and monitoring frequency as "Check finished product 1 sample / month". The monitoring frequency did not be determined based on definition of seven HACCP principles. 

 Critical limits are set at each CCP according to the validated processes, industry standards, or scientific and regulatory guidance. Critical limits for CCP - 'Raw material receiving' are 1) Accepted shrimps from approved supplier 2) The letter of guarantee from approved supplier indicating proper drug usage and no pesticides exceeding the action level accompanying all batches of incoming pond-raised shrimp; 3) All incoming batch of shrimp must be accompanied by a lot by lot certificate stating that sulfiting agents were not used and incoming batch of shrimp must not contain 10 ppm or greater sulfiting agents. Critical limits for CCP - 'Cooking' are minimum cooking time, cooking temperature according to guidance (S-09-A-013). Critical limits for CCP - 'Batter mix recirculation tank' is hydrated batter mix temperature not exceed 10 °C and the time taken not more than 2 hours cumulatively. Critical limit for CCP - 'Putting in plastic bag / seal / vacuum bag / inner carton / shrink' and 'Packing in master carton' is finished product labels must declare the presence of allergen in the product. Critical limit for CCP - 'Metal detecting' is absence of metal fragment in finished product with limit of detection (Fe, Non-Fe, and SUS) according to guidance (S-09-A-009). Critical limit for CCP - 'Baking' are minimum baking temperature 110 - 115 °C not less than 30 minutes; maximum moisture content of product 2.5%; and Aw (water activity) < 0.6.
LongName: All critical limits set at each CCP shall be properly identified and followed.  Critical limits shall be based on validated processes, industry standards or scientific and regulatory guidance.
Question: All critical limits set at each CCP shall be properly identified and followed.  Critical limits shall be based on validated processes, industry standards or scientific and regulatory guidance.
Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

The facility said they did not declare 3 different lots when submitted the sample to the third party laboratory.

This nonconformity is also related to 5.15.3.
 The facility collects products according to the current sampling plan (F-01-B-033, date 26 December 2016) and send to third party laboratory (i.e. SGS (Thailand) Limited) to analyze. The current sampling plan indicated the facility classified finished products into 5 groups (i.e. raw products, cooked products, breaded products, sushi products, and SPTO products) and the facility analyzed one sample per group every 4 months

AuditDetail: During the facility tour, the auditor observed that there is not any method of disinfection which will kill the disease organisms before release to natural water. The facility treated its own effluents by screening out solids, oil, and grease before treated waste water using activated sludge. The treated process involves adding oxygen, adjust pH, filtration, and sedimentation. The treated water from the treatment plant was overflow and discharged to the natural waters - Gulf of Thailand.
LongName: To minimize the chance of disease transmission from effluents discharged to natural waters, plants shall screen out solids and treat effluents by chlorination or another method of disinfection which will kill the disease organisms before release. AuditDetail: Critical limits are set at each CCP according to the validated processes, industry standards, or scientific and regulatory guidance. Critical limits for CCP at - 'Raw material receiving' are 1) received from approved outsourcing providers bought from Thai DOF and/or BAP certified farms; 2) sulfite < 10 ppm; and 3) analysis reports showed 'not detection' results for all antibiotics. Critical limit for CCP at - 'Battering' is Temperature not exceed 10 C and time taken not more than 12 hours cumulatively. Critical limits for CCPat - 'Cooking / Frying' are 1) cooker temperature and time follow HACCP Plan (depend on no. oc cooker) / Frying temperature and time follow HACCP plan ; 2) initial core product temperature; Critical limit for CCP at - 'Packing' is ensuring that label properly declare shrimp, including other allergens based on ingredients of each products. Critical limit for CCP at - 'Metal detecting' is not detect Fe, Non-Fe and SUS follow HACCP Plan

AuditDetail:
The HACCP plans mandate the test of raw material for every lot at receiving for aquaculture drug with samples taken as per BAP standard requirements,
- Raw material is tested per every lots by internal lab bi-annual verification by certified third party lab for banned drugs residue and for heavy metal, pesticide residue, e.g., 
- In-house lab and certified third party lab test results 04 samples from raw material lots received dated 31 Dec 2016, 21 Mar, 15 Jun and 28 Jul 2017 and third party lab Nafi 5 lab test results #YE 0694-HH/2017, #YE 0695-HH/2017, #YE 0696-HH/2017 dated 10 Feb 2017; #YE 3398-HH/2017, #YE 3400-HH/2017, #YE 3399-HH/2017 dated 15 May 2017; SGS lab test result #1702170352 dated 17 Feb 2017, Warrantek lab test results #170200823 dated 20 Feb 2017 showed samples had been tested for CAP, AOZ, AMOZ, AHD, SEM, MG, LMG, Crystal Violet, Leuco Crystal Violet, Sarafloxacine, Flumequine, Oxolinic Acid, Trifluralin, Enro, Cipr, Tetracyline, Oxy tetracyline, Sulfonamide group (13 subtances), Sulfite and other chemicals.
Verification quarterly and bi-annually, annually the facility raw material sources from suppliers on AVL which source raw material from aquaculture areas which is monitored, controlled and approved by Nafiqad for intensive farms in Vietnam (Nafiqad South region notifies monthly results of testing antibiotics and environment contaminant chemicals).
Refer more in details to attached files
However during document reviewing the auditor detected the LOQ of Enrofloxacine and Ciprofloxacine of Nafi 5 lab test results YE#9854-HH/2017 dated 08 Nov 2016, #YE 3398/HH-2017 dated 15 May 2017 are higher than standard' requirement (Annex 5), it is 3 ppb instead of 1 ppb.

Where this occurs, records shall be maintained demonstrating which products of different BAP star categories were mixed, and that the star status of resultant product was properly downgraded. (Example: If 3 star BAP products are mixed with 2 star BAP products, then the entire product lot must be labelled as 2 star BAP product. The 3 star BAP products will lose its 3 star status.  Where 1 and 2 star products are mixed, or 1, 2 and 3 star products are mixed, the entire product lot shall be downgraded to 1 star).

However, Red round tank plastic stored cooked shrimp on during processing is not discolor cooked shrimp product as minor NC 4.

AuditDetail:
Emergency exits were marked and evacuation routes layout posted. Personal protective equipment sufficiently provided at place and interval status checked/recorded (for damaged, lost). Adequate number functioning fire extinguishers was provided at each area: hose reel around the building, chemical warehouse, CO2 extinguisher at workshop, canteen, and sand tank at fuel tanks.
However, The Emergency door at freezing of cooked shrimp area was clocked.
LongName: The facility shall ensure proper measures for fire protection and prevention in all work, rest, dining, and where applicable, housing areas.   This includes but is not limited to:  adequate numbers of functioning fire extinguishers; emergency exits and evacuation routes that are clearly marked, properly lit and kept clear and unlocked while employees are present; proper training and enforcement for handling of flammable liquids and chemicals; and procedures to prevent fires during such activities as welding.

Suppliers: Chicken of the Sea Frozen Foods-Supplier

For example General Manager authorizes the changes and Factory Manager approves the changes in case of FSQMS manual. AuditDetail: Procedure for Packing & Labeling (SOP/PMP/118) is developed and well implemented. It includes how different BAP star products are labelled . It includes how proper labeling of different star rated products throughout the process is done. SOP/46- However, procedure is not addressing downgrading of the star status of products in the event the facility mixes product of different BAP star categories accidentally.
LongName: The label control procedure referred to in 7.1.2 shall include a procedure for the proper labelling and downgrading of the star status of products in the event the facility mixes product of different BAP star categories. Where this occurs, records shall be maintained demonstrating which products of different BAP star categories were mixed, and that the star status of resultant product was properly downgraded. (Example: If 3 star BAP products are mixed with 2 star BAP products, then the entire product lot must be labelled as 2 star BAP product. The 3 star BAP products will lose its 3 star status.  Where 1 and 2 star products are mixed, or 1, 2 and 3 star products are mixed, the entire product lot shall be downgraded to 1 star).

(Note:  Food Defense risks are not HACCP related but rather facility security/sabotage related.  Intended to prevent, for instance:   tampering or adulteration of product or the water supply by entry of unauthorized personnel, entry by disgruntled or terminated employees, uncontrolled access to storage areas, or access to and misuse of toxic compounds in the facility).

AuditDetail:
Risk assessment is done for cleaning process of high risk and low risk area, documented in GMP/SFC/08, Processing facility was found maintained in cleaned and hygienic condition in most cases. Cleaning is done by in-house cleaning team. Through cleaning is done every day after completion of production for process area equipment with soap solution, sanitisation with 100 ppm chlorine, for food contact surface. Water pressure gun is used to remove physical dart from IQF belt. Soap solution is used as per validation study.
Cleaning method is manual cleaning with water pressure, use of brush, dismantling of equipment, approved sanitizer, soap solution is used, and COP is followed.
Monthly IQF freezer belt is cleaning after dismantling the freezer.
Documented procedure was available for cleaning of food contact and non –food contact surfaces in SSOP/RM/05, SSOP/PP/07-04. SSOP/FC/08, SSOP/CS/09. Cleaning Manual.

Validation of cleaning process is done dated 21.10.2015. Allergen validation with cleaning done dated 7.11.2015 for Sulphite residue < 10 ppm.   GMP/STF/09. 


Daily microbiology swab testing is done from food and non food contact surface for Listeria, TPC, Coliforms , record was seen in GMP/HRA/12.

Water storage cleaning is done once in 15th day. Record was seen in FMT/SSOP/13. Microbilogical swab testing is done VC, Coliforms. 
 
Daily food contact equipment and processing area cleaning record is maintained, visual inspection done by QC Technologists, report was seen for month of MAY 2017. Regular hygiene training is carried out for concerned persons.
Cleaning equipments of different process section is dedicated, and stored separately at that section; cleaning equipment used for high-risk-area is not used in other section of operation.
Effectiveness is verified by visual verification as well by swab testing. Swab test done for food contact surface once in every 15 days as per swab testing plan and High-risk area product contact surface. TPC, coliform, Staph (acceptable limits less than 100 cfu/ Sq cm, Nil, Nil), report was seen for food contact surface dated 04.07.2017 from Freezing Machine, reported as 24cfu/sq2.
No failure on microbiological trend was noted in last 6 months.
No CIP is in use.
Cleaning equipments are dedicated for high-risk area.
Cleaning procedure is validated.

Product contact surface cleaning for High Risk area- potable water pressuregun, application of Foam- SU 729  4% for 30 minute, pressure gun water, 100 ppm chlorine rinsing, potable water rinsing, verification with pH paper and Chlorine paper for cleaning chemical residue. Fumigation is done with SU 319 - 3% for 40 minute.

Cleaning Records were verfied in- FMT/SSOP/08 dated 06.05.2017.   

DEV- Cleaning condition of grading machine belt of raw product handling section was found not in good condition during audit.
LongName: Work surfaces that come in contact with food products (tables, equipment, utensils, employee gloves and clothing) shall be in good condition and adequately cleaned and sanitized before use.
Question: Work surfaces that come in contact with food products (tables, equipment, utensils, employee gloves and clothing) shall be in good condition and adequately cleaned and sanitized before use.

LongName: The label control procedure referred to in 7.1.2 shall include a procedure for the proper labelling and downgrading of the star status of products in the event the facility mixes product of different BAP star categories. Where this occurs, records shall be maintained demonstrating which products of different BAP star categories were mixed, and that the star status of resultant product was properly downgraded. (Example: If 3 star BAP products are mixed with 2 star BAP products, then the entire product lot must be labelled as 2 star BAP product. The 3 star BAP products will lose its 3 star status.  Where 1 and 2 star products are mixed, or 1, 2 and 3 star products are mixed, the entire product lot shall be downgraded to 1 star).

AuditDetail:
Facility taken enough care to avoid accidental release of non native
species to natural habitats like providing screens of sizes 100 microns,
150 micron, 250 micron 350 micron and 500 micron at various stages
like all the out lets of the tanks and packing section drains. They have a
final control at effluent treatment as they chlorinate the effluent water
with 20 ppm chlorine to kill all the escaped organisms before release of
the effluent water to sea. The screen are monitored daily basis same
was documented in Screen Intact Verification Record
(FMT/SOP/HATC/10) records for the month of Aug & Sept 2018 were
seen. However, one of the scoop net with 500 micron mesh, used for
Post Larval harvest was found damaged on the day of audit

AuditDetail:
Process controls identify corrective actions taken when a critical limit for an identified hazards has been breached.
1. Raw Material Receiving & Storage Procedure(SOP-GCSLP-C3.1, Rev 00 dated 2016.8.25).
2. HACCP plan FSMSM-HD-01 dated 2017.8.17. 
CCP 1: Post conditioner: CCP1: steam temperature, 80-105C, 9 times per day
CCP 2: Magnet catcher before packing for pellet feed, 3 times per day
CCP 3: Crumble plan shifter ((#28 to #40): once a day
CCP 4: Fish meal & poultry meal, check COA on every delivery. 
Corrective actions were identified for CCP1, CCP2, CCP3 and CCP4. However, for CCP4, fish meal from Scouler with Contract #SEW022968 dated 2017.7.11 without COA and did not reject

AuditDetail:
"For transportation, post larvae are put into oblong 100 L plastic tank, oxygen is pumped in. The plastic bins are pick up by truck. The transportation truck will control by locked with seal. No transporting by waterway. 

Measures to minimize escape of farm stock are implemented. The measures to minimize escape include screen and net installation at water inlet pipe to minimize the introduction of local aquatic fauna and at the discharge pipe to prevent escapes of cultivated shrimps. The growthout ponds not have the water gate. Farm also inspection the fine mesh screen and net during the harvesting activity. These screens and nets sized to retain the smallest farmed animals.

Inspection record for fine mesh screen and net in 2017 were provided.  However, no observation  inspection record for fine mesh screen and net during the harvesting activity. "

AuditDetail:
Based on interview and record review, the facility did not discharge the cultivated water to natural water body. Based on the notification of the Ministry of Natural Resource and Environment controlled by Thai Pollution Control Department (Thai PCD), every aquaculture cultivation facility located on brackish area have to report effluent discharge volume monthly. However, the facility did not aware of this regulation and no report to the authority for the effluent discharge volume. 
This facility has been assessed as a certified aquatic animal hatchery / nursery Good Aquaculture Practice (GAP) by Thai Department of Fisheries (Thai DOF). GAP standard is normally concerned about environment as well. The garbage is removed from the premises by local municipal. Receipt for service fee during October 2016 to October 2017 from local municipal for garbage removal service was available to review."
LongName: Current documents shall be available to prove compliance with applicable environmental regulations for construction and operation.
Question: Current documents shall be available to prove compliance with applicable environmental regulations for construction and operation.

AuditDetail:
The facility did not record the volume of intake water pumped from the Bangpakong River. 
Records of usage water volume during January to September 2017 were available to review. The records showed the volume of water pump to cultivation tanks, the volume of water pump out of cultivation tanks, and the volume of water pump to water reservoir for recycle use. Based on discussion, there is no effluent water discharged back to natural water body.
LongName: Records on intake water and effluent monitoring shall be maintained and available.
Question: Records on intake water and effluent monitoring shall be maintained and available.

AuditDetail: There is no evidence or analysis test for the presence of contaminants or toxicants for all used feed.Facility recorded lots of each dry feed type that bought for each cycle (crop). The dry feed are from registered feed manufacturers: Inve and Thai Union Feed Mill, Mahachai. Each feed mill provided guarantee letters about the formulation of each lot e.g. % protein and % oil.
LongName: Accurate records shall be kept of all feeds used, their sources and any tests undertaken for the presence of contaminants or toxicants.
Question: Accurate records shall be kept of all feeds used, their sources and any tests undertaken for the presence of contaminants or toxicants.

AuditDetail: There is no statement or declaration letter about the significant stock characteristics of the cultivated sea bass / barramundi bought from the registered hatcheries. The facility bought the juveniles from the registered hatcheries with Thai DOF. Due to these hatcheries did not certify against GAP, the Fry Movement Documents cannot be issued. However, there are selling records detailing of the bought juveniles for each lot (e.g. species, size, quantity, and price) from these hatcheries kept on file.
LongName: The facility shall maintain accurate records of the species produced and, where relevant, any significant stock characteristics, including but not limited to non-native, specific pathogen-free, specific pathogen-resistant, sterile, hybrid, triploid, sex-reversed or genetically modified status. Records shall also include documentation to support the stock characteristic claims made.
Question: The facility shall maintain accurate records of the species produced and, where relevant, any significant stock characteristics, including but not limited to non-native, specific pathogen-free, specific pathogen-resistant, sterile, hybrid, triploid, sex-r

Question: Based on the risk analysis, employees shall be trained in its findings and the efficacy of procedures to monitor and reduce escape risks and effectively respond to escape events shall be documented through the year.

AuditDetail: There is no list of speicies classified as endangers or threatened under regional laws and/or the IUCN Red List available on file.

Question: The facility shall maintain a list of species that occur within the vicinity of the hatchery that are classified as endangered or threatened under regional laws and/or the IUCN Red List.

AuditDetail: During the site tour, the auditor found an unlabeled bottle of transparent liquid near the unused brood stock tanks.Dry feeds are stored in locked room near the production area together with the equipment / tool. Chemical is stored in a separated room. Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) of the chemicals that stored in the chemical storage such as Formalin, Chlorine, Iodine, and Hydrochloride were posted. Fuel is stored in air pumping room.
LongName: Fuel, lubricants, feed and chemicals used at the facility shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner. A list of such materials together with Material Safety Data Sheets for them shall be maintained and be made available to the auditor.
Question: Fuel, lubricants, feed and chemicals used at the facility shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner. A list of such materials together with Material Safety Data Sheets for them shall be maintained and be made availabl

AuditDetail: There are four fire extinguishers in this facility: the first is located at air pumping / fuel storage room, the second is located at the transferring fingerlings areas, and the others are located at the feed / tool storage room; however, during the audit, one of the fire extinguishers at the feed / tool storage found to be empty.The precautions taken to prevent spills, fires and explosions procedure was available. Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) of the chemicals that stored in the chemical storage were available. A sand bucket is provided in each risk area such as air pumping / fuel storage room and chemical storage room as absorbent material. All workers were trained about chemical leakage, safety, and how to use fire extinguisher on 21 July 2017.
LongName: Precautions shall be taken to prevent spills, fires and explosions, and procedures and supplies shall be readily available to manage chemical and fuel spills or leaks. Designated staff shall be trained to manage such spills and leaks.
Question: Precautions shall be taken to prevent spills, fires and explosions, and procedures and supplies shall be readily available to manage chemical and fuel spills or leaks. Designated staff shall be trained to manage such spills and leaks.

AuditDetail: Small fuel tanks (about 30 L) were stored in the air-pumping room with the mobile generator. However, there is no secondary containment at the air pumping / fuel storage room.
LongName: Secondary fuel containment shall conform to BAP guidelines for fuel storage.
Question: Secondary fuel containment shall conform to BAP guidelines for fuel storage.

AuditDetail:
There are 2 manufacturers of dry feeds used in this facility. Based on the label on each feed, it indicated one of the composites is fish, but it is unclear what kind of fish used when manufacture of these feed. There are no statements or letter of guarantees from both dry feed manufacturers (Inve and Thai Union Feed Mill - Mahachai) to ensure that they are met the requirement of 13.5. (This nonconformity is also related to 7.6)
From labels of each container, these feed are registered with Thai DOF indicated that they are safe for use. According to Thai Regulation, medicated feed is prohibited in the production of feed manufacturer.

Question: The facility shall have a training program for designated facility staff who implement the HMP and documents to confirm that such training has been given. Their understanding of the HMP will be verified by interview during the facility audit.

AuditDetail: Based on interview, transport containers for shipping live animals are cleaned and sanitized using proviodine (iodine) between uses; however, there is no written procedure and/or record about this activity.

Question: Transport containers for shipping live animals shall be clean and if reused shall be sterilized between uses.

AuditDetail: During the audit, the auditor was able to review records of bought juveniles, bought and used feed in each cycle / crop, and fry movement documents for sold fingerlings; however, the facility was unable to link these documents together. (This nonconformity is also related to 15.5, 15.6, and 15.7)
LongName: The facility shall keep complete and accurate records for each culture unit and production cycle, including the culture unit identification number, unit area and volume, species and, if applicable, species specification such as triploid or GMO.
Question: The facility shall keep complete and accurate records for each culture unit and production cycle, including the culture unit identification number, unit area and volume, species and, if applicable, species specification such as triploid or GMO.

AuditDetail: There is no complaint in the past 12 months; however, there is no complaint handling record that included investigation for root cause and action taken available.

Question: The facility shall keep records of investigations of such complaints and actions taken to address/correct them.

AuditDetail:
"Hatchery / Nursery operation license no. #2402246995, issued by Chachoengsao Provincial Fisheries Office which is Local Thai Department of Fisheries and it is valid from 10 July 2015 until 10 July 2018.  This Hatchery / Nursery certified Good Aquaculture Practice for Marine Shrimp Hatchery / Nursery-GAP by Thai Department of Fisheries, the certificate no. #24202-24-GAPC-0-04-57-00002 and the certificate is valid from 26 July 2015 until 25 July 2018. However, both Hatchery / Nursery operation license and the GAP certificate were expired. 
This Hatchery / Nursery is also certified of rearing/producing Aquaculture Establishment for export by Thai Department of Fisheries, the certificate no. #TH 2422140002 and the certificate is valid from 6 September 2016 until 25 July 2019. 
"
LongName: Current documents shall be available to prove all business and operating licenses have been acquired.
Question: Current documents shall be available to prove all business and operating licenses have been acquired.

AuditDetail:
"The facility hired subcontracted drivers to delivery their products to the clients. However, there are no copies of their licenses
available for inspection."

Question: Employees shall be appropriately licensed to drive or use equipment for which public licenses are required, and a list of such licensed employees and copies of their licenses shall be available for inspection.

AuditDetail: All dry feeds are properly stored in clean locked room.  All dry feeds stored in the shelf and the shelf have 1 feet perimeter from the wall that easy for inspection.  However, during the site tour, the auditor observed 2 sack of current dry feeds used were not stored under cover with temperature control as label.
LongName: All feed shall be stored under cover with temperature control (as needed) and enough space from the walls to allow ventilation and movement for inspection.
Question: All feed shall be stored under cover with temperature control (as needed) and enough space from the walls to allow ventilation and movement for inspection.

AuditDetail: The manuals in this facility covers all potential risks; however, there is no evidence or date that ensure that risk analysis for potential cause of escape was conducted annually.(This NC is also related to 9.2)
LongName: A site risk analysis, updated at least annually, shall be conducted that identifies the potential and actual causes of escapes, determines the relative likelihood of their occurrence or recurrence, and identifies critical control points for effective escape risk monitoring, reduction and response.
Question: A site risk analysis, updated at least annually, shall be conducted that identifies the potential and actual causes of escapes, determines the relative likelihood of their occurrence or recurrence, and identifies critical control points for effective esca

AuditDetail: The facility monitored the condition of net and screen at the intake water pipe before pumping water in. Inspection record for these net and screen at the intake water pipe was available for review.  Fine mesh screens were also installed at the end of water pipe of cultivation zone to ensure no escape of cultivated animal during water exchange. The auditor was informed that these screens were subjected to be checked for its condition. However, these screens is not monitored daily. Moreover, no observation Inspection record available on the audit date.
LongName: All screens shall be well maintained and checked for damage at least daily and effluents shall be monitored for the presence of live organisms with records kept to demonstrate compliance.
Question: All screens shall be well maintained and checked for damage at least daily and effluents shall be monitored for the presence of live organisms with records kept to demonstrate compliance.

AuditDetail: Hatchery / Nursery Manual, Health management and Animal Welfare Procedure define and justify acceptable minimum water quality limits for the cultivated live animals.  The local Thai DOF performed analysis (i.e. physical, chemical, and microbiological) for cultivation water. Asian Feed Co., Ltd., the sponsor for this audit, also performs in-house analysis for this facility. Water monitoring records related to current activity tanks were reviewed. However, water quality is not monitored daily.
LongName: The AWS shall define and justify acceptable minimum water quality limits for the species being reared. Daily or more frequent monitoring records shall show that when these limits are breached, immediate corrective action is taken.
Question: The AWS shall define and justify acceptable minimum water quality limits for the species being reared. Daily or more frequent monitoring records shall show that when these limits are breached, immediate corrective action is taken.

AuditDetail:
"All hatchery stock appearance and behavior of cultivated live animals are visually monitored by the head workers. When there is any signs of distress or ill health, some representative of that suspicious tanks were sent to local Thai DOF to check or verify the health condition. Analysis reports from Thai DOF were available to review.  
The record of the appearance and behavior related to current activity tank was kept on file and available for review.  However, the appearance and behavior is not monitored daily.
"
LongName: The appearance and behavior of all hatchery stocks shall be observed at least daily for signs of distress or ill health. Actions taken to correct signs of distress or ill health shall be documented.
Question: The appearance and behavior of all hatchery stocks shall be observed at least daily for signs of distress or ill health. Actions taken to correct signs of distress or ill health shall be documented.

AuditDetail:
"Health certificates for current activity lot of Juveniles received from Pimpanich hatchery are available on file. The facility also requested the local Thai DOF to reconfirm the health of the Juveniles after introduction in a few days. Analysis reports from the local Thai DOF were available for review.
However, no observation health certificates/analysis reports in 2017. 

"
LongName: Health status documents for all live aquatic products brought into the facility since the last audit shall be available and shall demonstrate the products were free of diseases (to the extent detection is possible) listed in 14.5 or entered quarantine and were released into the rest of the hatchery only once disease-free status was established. This excludes locally endemic diseases.

AuditDetail: The health management plan detailed the procedures and indicators for physical appearance, feeding response, and mortality, or of larval development and / or growth rate at biologically relevant intervals.  Feeding response is monitored daily. However, the physical appearance and mortality are not monitored daily.
LongName: The HMP shall describe the procedures and indicators used by staff to monitor and document the health of facility stocks.These can include daily or more frequent observations of physical appearance, feeding response and mortality, or of larval development and/or growth rate at biologically relevant intervals.

The tank is treated with chlorine and iodine using for cultivation. The dryout periods at least 7 days in each tank and planned and used to break infection cycles.  However, no observation record available on the audit date.

Question: The HMP shall explain how fallowing or dryout periods in different parts of the facility are planned and used to break infection cycles. Records shall be available to show this is done.

Question: All labor, recruiting or employment services used by the facility must be licensed to operate by the local or national government as a labor provider.

Question: The HACCP plan or equivalent system shall adequately address potential chemical, biological and other safety hazards with appropriate preventive measures and monitoring, corrective actions and verification procedures.

AuditDetail: Environmental regulations and operations were proved by Department of Fisheries Thailand. This farm is certified aquatic animal farm that maintained under Good Agricultural Practice (GAP) by Department of Fisheries. The farm informed the auditor they tried to avoid discharged the water back to the natural water body and all cultivated water is treated and recycling use in this farm. Based on interview and record review, the facility did not discharge the cultivated water to natural water body. Based on the notification of the Ministry of Natural Resource and Environment controlled by Thai Pollution Control Department (Thai PCD), every aquaculture cultivation facility located on brackish area have to report effluent discharge volume monthly. However, the facility did not aware of this regulation and no report to the authority for the effluent discharge

AuditDetail: The biosecurity plan to prevent the introduction and spread of disease agents and disease on farm was issued. However, the biosecurity plan was not detail the sanitization of equipment and personnel when disease is suspected. Moreover, There is the local public road among growthout pond no.1, 2, 3 and 4. Therefore, farm was not screen visitor. All visitor can access to the growthout pond no.1, 2, 3 and 4. (This is also related to 17.2)
LongName: The applicant shall have in place biosecurity controls that seek to prevent the introduction and spread of disease agents and disease on the farm, including the sanitization of equipment and personnel when disease is suspected or confirmed at the farm site, and these shall be detailed in a biosecurity plan as described in the Implementation guidelines above.
Question: The applicant shall have in place biosecurity controls that seek to prevent the introduction and spread of disease agents and disease on the farm, including the sanitization of equipment and personnel when disease is suspected or confirmed at the farm sit

AuditDetail: Trash bins with covers are available. However, garbage from housing were found to be thrown around the worker housing, not in the trash bins.
LongName: Garbage from housing and food waste shall be retained in water-tight receptacles with covers to protect contents from insects, rodents and other animals.
Question: Garbage from housing and food waste shall be retained in water-tight receptacles with covers to protect contents from insects, rodents and other animals.

AuditDetail: Base on interview with farm manager and the harvesting procedure indicated steps for the best practices during harvesting.  The time periods of fasting (before harvest about 12-24 hours), knocking caught / harvested fish in iced water for 10 minutes in 500 L tanks.  When harvesting in this farm, the harvest team entering cultivation pond with catching net.  However, farm has not recorded the time of fasting.
LongName: The facility shall define upper limits for time periods of fasting, crowding and time out of water to ensure best welfare practices and provide accurate records showing that these limits are respected.
Question: The facility shall define upper limits for time periods of fasting, crowding and time out of water to ensure best welfare practices and provide accurate records showing that these limits are respected.

LongName: The applicant shall not engage in or support the use of child labor. The applicant shall comply with national child labor laws regarding minimum working age or ILO Minimum Age Convention 138, whichever is higher. However the harvest procedure did not cover the upper limits for time periods of fasting, crowding and time out of water to ensure best welfare practices.

AuditDetail:
Emergency respond procedure(GL-NS/GAP-II-0013), Employee health
& safety and welfare management procedure(GL-NS/GAP-II-006) and
Health & safety assessment report(GL-NS/GAP-006，dated 2017-11-
01) are prepared for the site; there is also First Aid kits at the site.
There is a Health & safety assessment of workplace hazards
conducted by a 7 person team. There are three assessments - Low ,
Medium and High Risk Assessments - Areas assessed are Fire, Gas
Leak, Food Poison, Injury from car and laboratory, manual handling,
electrical shock, sudden sickness at night (hospital is 10 minutes away
from the farm), personnel hygiene.
There would be an investigation at the site if there ever was an
accident. There has not been any incident in the last 12 months.
However the workplace health &safety hazards risk assessment was
not taken into account the drowning and sunstroke risk.
LongName: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment. This included a requirement for accident investigation.
Question: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment. This included a requirement for accident investigation.

AuditDetail: Environmental regulations and operations were proved by Department of Fisheries Thailand. AuditDetail:

AuditDetail: From contract and interview, there is a deduction about 1,000 THB each as guarantee budget. The contract clearly indicated that this guarantee budget will be refund when the worker resigned from the company and did not cause any damage or problem to the company. On the other hand, if there is any damage or resign without suitable time notice, the company will not refund this guarantee budget and the salary of last month might be deducted at maximum 50%. These policy seems to be breach the labor law announced in 2008.
LongName: The facility shall not require the payment of deposits, deduction from wages or withholding of pay that is not part of a legal contractual agreement with the employee and/or that is not provided for or permitted by national law.
Question: The facility shall not require the payment of deposits, deduction from wages or withholding of pay that is not part of a legal contractual agreement with the employee and/or that is not provided for or permitted by national law.

AuditDetail: A written contract between Napaya company and each worker details the terms of employment, the work hours expected and mandated work week, worker rights, compensation, and facility policies regarding disciplinary actions. However, the signed contracts are as same as ones signed by monthly salary workers, so it is unclear for the hiring rate and frequency of payment
LongName: The facility shall provide to all workers, whether hourly, salaried, piece-rate, temporary, seasonal or otherwise, prior to hire and during employment, written and understandable information regarding the terms of employment, worker rights, benefits, compensation, hours expected, details of wages for each pay period and facility policies regarding disciplinary actions, grievance procedures, authorized deductions from pay and similar labor-related issues. This information must be provided in the prevalent language of the majority of employees.
Question: The facility shall provide to all workers, whether hourly, salaried, piece-rate, temporary, seasonal or otherwise, prior to hire and during employment

AuditDetail: In 2016, this farm cultivated Litopenaeus vannamei and Penaeus monodon. Based on the calculated fish in : fish out (FIFO) ratio mentioned in 9.4 as 1.52 for L. vannamei and 2.26 for P. monodon, the FIFO in 2016 for both species exceed the suggested values
LongName: The fish in:fish out ratio shall not exceed the following values:  Litopenaeus vannamei – 1.2, Penaeus monodon – 1.7, tilapia – 0.7, Pangasius – 0.5  Limits have not yet been fixed for other species, and will be added once adequate data has been accumulated.  For other species the values shall be recorded as information only.

AuditDetail: In Thailand, all farmed aquatic animals need to get movement documents. There are Aquatic Animal Fry Movement Documents (FMD) and Aquatic Animal Movement Documents (MD) which are able to be used for traceabilty. For the number of FMD and MD, the first 2 digits are the province that the hatchery / nursery / farm is located, the next 3 digits are the registered number of approved organization issuing the document, the next 6 digits are DDMMYY (issued date of the document), and the last 4 digits are the sequence of the document on the issued date. Aquatic Animal Fry Movement Document (FMD) details the hatchery selling the post larvae (name, address, farmer ID, and CoC/GAP number), the selling post larvae species, the number of selling post larvae / fry, the stage / size / age of the post larvae, and the selling date in section 1. FMD also includes the information about the buyer / purchaser (this audited farm) in section 2. FMD, fully completed for section 1 and 2, related to traced lots were available for review as detailed in 18.2.
LongName: The facility shall maintain accurate records of the species farmed and, where relevant, any significant stock characteristics, including but not limited to non-native, specific pathogen-free, specific pathogen-resistant, hybrid, triploid, sex-reversed or genetically modified (GMO) status.

AuditDetail: Net is used at the water intake areas to roughly screen adult animals and garbage before water inlet pumping from natural water body. Full fiber (about 150 mesh) is used at water inlet pipes to cultivation ponds to minimize the introduction of local aquatic fauna from water reservoirs or water treatment ponds. Double layer of fine screen (about 26 mesh) is used at the end of discharge pipes - sludge sucking pipe during cultivation. Net and fine screen (about 26 mesh) are installed as double layer at the water gate to prevent the escape of the cultivated shrimps. The net, screen, and full fiber filter that used in this farm are able to retain the smallest farmed animals and minimize the introduction of local aquatic fauna.
LongName: Screens and nets sized to retain the smallest farmed animals present shall be installed on water outlet pumps, pipes or sluices. Screens, nets or other controls shall be installed on or near pump intakes to minimize the introduction of local aquatic fauna.
Question: Screens and nets sized to retain the smallest farmed animals present shall be installed on water outlet pumps, pipes or sluices.

LongName: Precautions shall be taken to prevent spills, fires and explosions, and procedures and supplies shall be readily available to manage chemical and fuel spills or leaks. Designated staff shall be trained to manage such spills and leaks.
Question: Precautions shall be taken to prevent spills, fires and explosions, and procedures and supplies shall be readily available to manage chemical and fuel spills or leaks.

AuditDetail: Trash bins are available. Garbage in this farm can be classified into 3 types: general garbage, recycled garbage, and toxic garbage. Due to only 4 workers / families stayed in this farm, there are not much garbage and the general garbage is normally removed from farm premises to dump into the local garbage dumpsters to prevent accumulation. However, during the site tour, the auditor observed all of the trash bins without covers and some general garbage such as food container thrown around the farm especially at the back of the sizing area. For recycled garbage, it were stored for selling.
LongName: Garbage from housing and food waste shall be retained in water-tight receptacles with covers to protect contents from insects, rodents and other animals.
Question: Garbage from housing and food waste shall be retained in water-tight receptacles with covers to protect contents from insects, rodents and other animals.

AuditDetail:
Two rodent mechanical cages with natural bait are installed in feed storage room and are subjected to be monitored daily. 

Daily inspection records for all rodent cages in 2016 were reviewed during the audit.

The farm also kept the feed in closed room which is net around the opened gaps to prevent the pest entry in this room. However, during the site tour, the auditor observed some gaps along the walls, some torn net, and the door cannot be closed properly.
LongName: Measures shall be taken to prevent infestation by animal and insect vectors and pests.
Question: Measures shall be taken to prevent infestation by animal and insect vectors and pests.

AuditDetail: There are proper secondary containment for the fuel tank storage at the electric generator, and maintenance shop; however, during the site tour, the auditor observed no secondary containment for fuel stored at the intake water pump areas.
LongName: Secondary fuel containment shall conform to BAP guidelines for fuel storage.
Question: Secondary fuel containment shall conform to BAP guidelines for fuel storage.

AuditDetail: There was no local regulation set up for the carcasses disposal. There is a written procedure how to handling the ill, deformed, or unmarketable shrimps such as informing related persons (e.g. farm manager, farm technician, all farm workers, neighbor, and local Thai DOF), restricted assess and activity for suspicious cultivated pond. However, there is no inspection form about these killing method and handling of the dead shrimps. Based on interview and document review, there are no case of unmarketable shrimps in 201
LongName: When ill, deformed or unmarketable specimens are removed, they shall be documented and killed by humane techniques, with the carcasses disposed of responsibly in accordance with applicable local and state regulations.
Question: When ill, deformed or unmarketable specimens are removed, they shall be documented and killed by humane techniques, with the carcasses disposed of responsibly in accordance with applicable local and state regulations.

AuditDetail:
Farm used feed from Feed Manufacturers that approved by Thai Government. According to Thai Regulation, medicated feed is prohibited in the production of feed manufacturing. Based on document review, farm used feed from Thai Union Feed Mill - Ranod facility which is non-BAP certified facility.

Statement to confirm that all shrimp feeds from Thai Union Feed Mill - Ranod facility did not contain antibiotic, melamine, and analogues dated 14 July 2016 is available. However, this statement did not clearly indicate that feeds are excluded by-products from same species, unsafe levels of heavy metals, and physical or other contaminants.
LongName: For feed suppliers that are not BAP-certified, statements are required attesting to the application of production procedures that exclude proactively prohibited drugs, by-products from same species, unsafe levels of heavy metals and physical or other contaminants.
Question: For feed suppliers that are not BAP-certified, statements are required attesting to the application of production procedures that exclude proactively prohibited drugs, by-products from same species, unsafe levels of heavy metals and physical or other cont

AuditDetail: A guideline for maximum limit of use and reason for use of all aquaculture chemicals are part of farm manual. Feed and pond additives (i.e. Mg, Ca, and Pondplus) used during cultivation were recorded on the daily cultivation record; however, there is no record for aquaculture chemicals used during water preparation and some probiotic and minerals used during the cultivation.
LongName: Feed, nutritional supplements or pond additives used, manufactured or prepared on the farm shall include procedures to ensure these substances do not contain unsafe levels of contaminants and contain only substances permitted by the appropriate national authorities.

AuditDetail: The workers of this farm were trained in biosecurity procedure on 11 - 13 March 2016. Each visitor has to get approval from the farm before entering the farm premises and complete health questionnaire before site tour; however, the auditor was not requested to complete the health questionnaire as biosecurity plan.
LongName: Farm staff shall be trained in biosecurity procedures and shall, along with all visitors, comply with them.
Question: Farm staff shall be trained in biosecurity procedures and shall, along with all visitors, comply with them.

AuditDetail: There was no use of drug treatment on this farm. Farm was maintained records aquaculture chemical used for culture pond. The farm procedure details aquaculture chemical used in farm include reason for use, method of use and quantity of use, except organic mineral , calcium "Diehard" brand and magnesiumsulfate.
LongName: Records shall be maintained for every application of drugs and other chemicals that include the date, compound used, reason(s) for use, antibiotic sensitivity test results, dose and harvest date for treated production lots. See the Traceability requirement. Periodic verification testing of the effectiveness of the withdrawal period shall be conducted. The auditor shall collect usage data for all antimicrobials. Names and quantities (Kg of active ingredient per MT of production) of any antimicrobials used in past 12 months
Question: Records shall be maintained for every application of drugs and other chemicals that include the date, compound used, reason(s) for use, antibiotic sensitivity test results, dose and harvest date for treated production lots ...

AuditDetail: As mention in 15.3 and 15.9, farm was not retain records specified in Section 15.
LongName: All records specified in Section 15 shall be retained for a period that exceeds both 12 months and the expected shelf life of the aquaculture products.
Question: All records specified in Section 15 shall be retained for a period that exceeds both 12 months and the expected shelf life of the aquaculture products.

AuditDetail: Due to only 3 workers stayed in both Torsaeng farm and Chor Chaisaeng farm, there are not much garbage and the general garbage is normally removed from farm premises to dump into the local garbage dumpsters to prevent accumulation. For recycled garbage, it were stored for selling.
LongName: Current documents shall be available to prove compliance with applicable environmental regulations for construction and operation.
Question: Current documents shall be available to prove compliance with applicable environmental regulations for construction and operation.

AuditDetail: Based on the observations and interviews, there is no sign of extending areas to sensitive wetlands or wetland buffers and it is illegal to extend areas to sensitive wetlands or mangroves.

Question: Dredge and fill activities shall not be conducted in sensitive wetlands or wetland buffers to increase the area available for pond construction.

AuditDetail: Removed sludge during cultivation through center sludge sucking pipe and left over sludge after whole pond harvesting will be moved to sludge ponds for sedimentation. Dry sediment might be removed from the sludge ponds to fix the pond slope during non cultivation period or use as fertilizer at palm plantation.
LongName: Removed sediment shall be properly contained and located to prevent the salinization of soil and groundwater and not cause other ecological nuisances.
Question: Removed sediment shall be properly contained and located to prevent the salinization of soil and groundwater and not cause other ecological nuisances.

AuditDetail:
Farm manual clearly details how fuel, lubricants, feed, and agricultural chemicals are identified, stored, used, and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner. 

For example, fuel is stored near the generator, at intake water pump station, and at the main fuel storage areas. 

The chemical storage and feed storage in this facility are also stored for Chor Chaisaeng farm as well. Aquaculture chemicals (e.g. Magnesium Sulfate, Sodium Bicarbonate, Calcium Chloride, Magnesium Chloride, and etc.) and additives (e.g. Vitamin C, Ocenic, Molasses) with clear identification / label for each chemical are stored in chemical storage areas separated from feed and employee housing. Sacks of feed are generally stored on the pallets away from walls in closed rooms. However, during the site tour, the auditor found two sacks of currently used feed were placed on floors and a few sacks of Magnesium were placed mixed with Calcium chloride.
LongName: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.
Question: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.

However, during the site tour, the auditor observed lots of broken floating foam float on the reservoir.

Discarded farm supplies and equipment are stored in specific areas to sell / remove from farm as necessary to avoid excessive accumulation.

Moreover, farm use some probiotic as additional nutritional supplements. However, there is no written procedure for maximum limit of use and reason for use of these probiotic. Moreover, farm was not records additional nutritional supplements used. (This NC is also related to 15.11)
Farm use aquaculture chemical during pond preparation step to adjust the water. Farm provided the guarantee letter to ensure these substances do not contain unsafe levels of contaminants and contain only substances permitted. There is written procedure for maximum limit of use and reason for use of these aquaculture chemicals. Farm records aquaculture chemical used in production pond during preparation step. LongName: The applicant shall have in place biosecurity controls that seek to prevent the introduction and spread of disease agents and disease on the farm, including the sanitization of equipment and personnel when disease is suspected or confirmed at the farm site, and these shall be detailed in a biosecurity plan as described in the Implementation guidelines above.

AuditDetail: Facility provides free of charge protective gears (e.g. gloves and mask) and enforces safety regulations for the employees. However, there are no face protector and safety coat which are two of the required protective gears as indicated on Material Safety Data Sheet of some used chemical, in this facility.
LongName: Protective gear and equipment in good working order shall be provided for employees (e.g., eye protection for welding, gloves for shop work, boots for wet areas). Auditor to verify deployment.
