AuditDetail: Farm have the ongoing training for the worker. The training topics include First aid, Safety, biosecurity, Chemical safety used and MSDS, chemical leakage, chemical spillage, hygiene, waste management and emergency plan. Training records for workers were verified during the audit. However, In the training records, Mr. Chinnawat Sriphakdi who is the new worker was not verified by the audit.
LongName: The applicant shall provide training in general health, personal hygiene and safety (including aquatic safety and the use of boats and associated equipment), first aid and contamination risks to all employees. Safety documents must be available in a language understood by the workforce.
Question: The applicant shall provide training in general health, personal hygiene and safety

AuditDetail: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner. However, due to there are 19 Burmese workers, label for calciumhydroxide, potassium permanganate and magnesium sulfate were not prepare in Burmese language.
LongName: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.
Question: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.

AuditDetail: The Subsopa Farm was unable to demonstrate that staff employed by brokers that have won bids to buy, harvest and grade shrimp from Subsopa ponds are employed under terms and conditions that meet Thai employment regulations or worker's rights in terms of minimum wage paid and terms and conditions. In future the Subsopa Farm will ask contractors that win bids to buy, harvest and grade shrimp from Subsopa ponds to sign a letter stating that all their staff are employed under terms and conditions that meet the Thai employment regulations or worker's rights in terms of minimum wage paid and terms and conditions.
LongName: Where contracted/subcontracted or temporary workers are hired through a labor or employment service, the facility shall ensure that the labor or employment service provides the above information prior to and during hire, in appropriate languages, to ensure workers are aware of their rights and conditions of employment as describes above.
Question: Where contracted/subcontracted or temporary workers are hired through a labor or employment service, the facility shall ensure that the labor or employment service provides the above information prior to and during hire

AuditDetail: The generator in the main road zone of the fish farm, which was recently constructed, has no secondary fuel containment for the generator fuel. The farm will install secondary fuel containment, with at least 110% the volume capacity, of the stored diesel for the generator.
LongName: Secondary fuel containment shall conform to BAP guidelines for fuel storage.
Question: Secondary fuel containment shall conform to BAP guidelines for fuel storage.

AuditDetail: The Subsopa Farm was adding a powdered compound called 'Robin' to the pelleted feed that it was feeding its shrimp. The farm was unable to confirm i) whether the product was approved by the Thai authorities for use in shrimp culture, ii) what ingredients were in the feed additive and iii) whether the ingredients and/or the product were banned in Thailand or the importing countries at the time of the audit.
LongName: Antibiotics or chemicals that are proactively prohibited in the producing or importing country shall not be used in feeds, pond additives or any other treatment.
Question: Antibiotics or chemicals that are proactively prohibited in the producing or importing country shall not be used in feeds, pond additives or any other treatment.

AuditDetail: Environmental regulations and operations were proved by Department of Fisheries Thailand. This farm is certified aquatic animal farm that maintained under Good Agricultural Practice (GAP) by Thai Department of Fisheries. The farm registered with Thai Pollution Control Department (Thai PCD) to report effluent discharge volume each month. Print screen indicated monthly submission for effluent discharge were provided. However, no observation monthly submission for effluent discharge during January-April 2017.
LongName: Current documents shall be available to prove compliance with applicable environmental regulations for construction and operation.
Question: Current documents shall be available to prove compliance with applicable environmental regulations for construction and operation.

AuditDetail: There is no observation document/evidence demonstrate interaction with the local community.
LongName: The applicant shall demonstrate interaction with the local community to avoid or resolve conflicts through meetings, committees, correspondence, service projects or other activities performed annually or more often.
Question: The applicant shall demonstrate interaction with the local community to avoid or resolve conflicts through meetings, committees, correspondence, service projects or other activities performed annually or more often.

AuditDetail: Farm did not conduct an assessment for all farm activities to identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards.
LongName: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment. This included a requirement for accident investigation.
Question: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment. This included a requirement for accident investigation.

AuditDetail: The emergency plan for serious illnesses or accidents was available. The emergency contact numbers were also posted  at the main gathering areas. However, due to there are 6 Burmese workers in this farm, the emergency contact number was not provided in Burmese language.
LongName: An emergency response plan shall be prepared for serious illness or accidents.
Question: An emergency response plan shall be prepared for serious illness or accidents.

AuditDetail: Farm bought the post larvae from various CP hatchery which are certified against BAP Hatchery Standard as CP Sichon - H10275 and CP Tabon – H10207. Farm also bought the post larvae from various CP hatchery which non certified against BAP Hatchery Standard as CP Satingpra(Songkla Province) and CP Promtep(Phuket Province).  The hatchery issued the pathogen testing result to confirmed the pathogen free of PLs.  However, base on document review, no observation statement from All CP Hatchery confirmed that Broodstock are specific pathogen-free, specific pathogen-resistant.
LongName: The facility shall maintain accurate records of the species farmed and, where relevant, any significant stock characteristics, including but not limited to non-native, specific pathogen-free, specific pathogen-resistant, hybrid, triploid, sex-reversed or genetically modified (GMO) status.
Question: The facility shall maintain accurate records of the species farmed and, where relevant, any significant stock characteristics, including but not limited to non-native, specific pathogen-free, specific pathogen-resistant, hybrid, triploid, sex-reversed or

AuditDetail:
"Based on the interviewed and site tour, the auditor was informed that the species growth in this farm is Litopenaeus vannamei – White Shrimps.  Farm bought the post larvae from various CP hatchery which are certified against BAP Hatchery Standard as CP Sichon - H10275 and CP Tabon – H10207. Farm also bought the post larvae from various CP hatchery which non certified against BAP Hatchery Standard as CP Satingpra(Songkla Province) and CP Promtep(Phuket Province).    

FMD number #839132306610003 indicated that L. vannamei were bought from CP Promtep(Phuket Province) and FMD number #909031005610004 indicated that L. vannamei were bought from CP Satingpra(Songkla Province) related to current cultivation pond were reviewed. 

However, no observation document to prove sources for post larvae pond no. 3 that activity on the audit date.
Moreover, due to the situation of the shrimp disease is still in doubt and farm experienced the infected shrimp in 2017. Farm does not retained FMD/document to prove sources for unmarketable shrimps. 

"
LongName: The facility shall keep records of sources and purchases of stocking material, and record the number stocked in each culture unit for each crop.
Question: The facility shall keep records of sources and purchases of stocking material, and record the number stocked in each culture unit for each crop.

AuditDetail:
"For transportation, post larvae are put into oblong 100 L plastic tank, oxygen is pumped in. The plastic bins are pick up by truck. The transportation truck will control by locked with seal. No transporting by waterway. 

Measures to minimize escape of farm stock are implemented. The measures to minimize escape include screen and net installation at all water inlet pump to minimize the introduction of local aquatic fauna and at the water gates to prevent escapes of cultivated shrimps. Moreover, water from water reservoir is pumped through full fiber to each cultivation pond. These screens and nets sized to retain the smallest farmed animals.

Monthly inspection record for fine mesh screen and net in 2017 were kept on file. However, no observation monthly record during May - August 2017. "
LongName: All holding, transport and culture systems shall be designed, operated and maintained to minimize the release of eggs, larval forms, juveniles and adult animals.
Question: All holding, transport and culture systems shall be designed, operated and maintained to minimize the release of eggs, larval forms, juveniles and adult animals.

AuditDetail: Fuel, lubricants and feed stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.  Normally, aquaculture chemical were stored in designate area. However,  there was improperly designate area and some chemical package was tear. Base on site tour, the auditor observed chemical package was tear at current activity pond. Moreover, the auditor found sack of currently used feed was placed on floors.
LongName: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.
Question: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.

AuditDetail: Agricultural chemicals are stored on the storage that separated with feed and there was not store in employee housing or kitchen areas, or near harvest equipment and supplies. Normally, the fuel were stored in designate area. However, base on site tour, the auditor observed one gallon of fuel stored in feed storage.
LongName: Fuel, lubricants and agricultural chemicals shall not be stored near feed, in employee housing or kitchen areas, or near harvest equipment and supplies.
Question: Fuel, lubricants and agricultural chemicals shall not be stored near feed, in employee housing or kitchen areas, or near harvest equipment and supplies.

AuditDetail:
However, base on site tour, the auditor observed many ants and fly at feed storage area.
There are rodent traps (cages) installed on this farm at feed storage warehouse and subjected to be inspected daily. The rodent inspection records were reviewed during the audit.
LongName: Measures shall be taken to prevent infestation by animal and insect vectors and pests.
Question: Measures shall be taken to prevent infestation by animal and insect vectors and pests.

AuditDetail:
"All product sale and the record of sale and MD was provide. There was no local regulation set up for the carcasses disposal. The methods that this farm managed ill, deformed, or unmarketable shrimps is based on the recommendation of the local Thai DOF. Base on interview with farm owner, diseased shrimps after stop all culture activities are either killed instantly by chlorination and dead shrimp are collected for burning.
The farm owner informed the auditor, farm experienced the infected shrimp in 2017. However, farm did not record ill, deformed and unmarketable shrimps. 
"

Farm was maintained records aquaculture chemical used in production pond during pond preparation step.  The records related to current cultivation ponds were reviewed.

Farm use some vitamin as additional nutritional supplements. However, Base on review the records related to trace lots, farm was not records additional nutritional supplements used. Moreover, no observation COA for all chemical and nutritional supplements.

"
LongName: Feed, nutritional supplements or pond additives used, manufactured or prepared on the farm shall include procedures to ensure these substances do not contain unsafe levels of contaminants and contain only substances permitted by the appropriate national authorities.
Question: Feed, nutritional supplements or pond additives used, manufactured or prepared on the farm shall include procedures to ensure these substances do not contain unsafe levels of contaminants and contain only substances permitted by the appropriate national a

"Normally, farm recorded quantity, number for each feed used, manufacturer and lot numbers for each feed used in the pond activity record and feed stock document.
However, Base on review the pond activity record related to current activity ponds, farm recorded lot numbers for each feed used but not all lot."
LongName: Complete and accurate records regarding manufacturer and lot numbers for each feed used shall be maintained.
Question: Complete and accurate records regarding manufacturer and lot numbers for each feed used shall be maintained.

AuditDetail: During onsite inspection, auditor observed that farm used the mobile water pump unit that have the fuel storage tank, however there was no secondary containment for the fuel storage tank as the BAP guideline.
LongName: Secondary fuel containment shall conform to BAP guidelines for fuel storage.
Question: Secondary fuel containment shall conform to BAP guidelines for fuel storage.

AuditDetail: The effluent water was sampling to test the values according to the requirement of BAP and the average result found to be complied with the initial BAP value, but the average soluble phosphorus in 2016 found to be at 0.391 mg / L which is beyond the final BAP value and this facility is certified for more than 5 years. From the monthly reports in 2016, the result of soluble phosphorus found to be higher than 0.3 mg /L for 6 months from 12 months. The facility has been aware of this for a while and the corrective action report issued on 21 July 2016 about this was reviewed; however, from the monthly reports in 2017 (January - April), the result of soluble phosphorus still found to be higher than 0.3 mg / L, except result in April that found to be 0.243 mg/L.
LongName: Hatcheries shall continue compliance with these criteria to maintain certification and comply with BAP’s final criteria within five years.
Question: Hatcheries shall continue compliance with these criteria to maintain certification and comply with BAP’s final criteria within five years.

AuditDetail: No clear evidence for the rest time before working and during overtime for some staff such as Mr.Noppasak and Mr.Supachai, However by interview he said his wages is corrected.
LongName: The applicant shall comply with national labor laws for pay, overtime and holiday compensation for hours worked beyond the regular work day or week.
Question: The applicant shall comply with national labor laws for pay, overtime and holiday compensation for hours worked beyond the regular work day or week.

AuditDetail: Risk assessment was done. However, some area was not included in this risk assessment, such as the activity at pelleting and finished product loading.

Question: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment. This includes a requirement for accident investigation.

AuditDetail:
"Based on summary of cultivation activities in 2017.  Full set reports related to 2 pond were reviewed / verified during the audit. The traceability record was detail from Aquatic Animal Fry Movement Document (FMD). The record of daily pond activity. The detail and record of feed and aquaculture substance used. The harvesting record and Aquatic Animal Movement Document (MD). The completed record of
Pond no.3A; FMD Number #839120106600001, indicated that post larvae were bought from East Asia Aquaculture Hatchery which is certified BAP Hatchery.
MD Number #822022709600002 showed that shrimps size 47 pieces/ kg, 3,000 Kg were harvested on 28 September 2017. The purchaser is Okenos food.           
MD Number #822021810600009 showed that shrimps size 36 pieces/ kg, 2,500 Kg were harvested on 19 October 2017. The purchaser is Okenos food.           

Pond no.3B; FMD Number #839120108600002, indicated that post larvae were bought from East Asia Aquaculture Hatchery which is certified BAP Hatchery.
MD Number #822022411600013 showed that shrimps size 45 pieces/ kg, 11,000 Kg were harvested on 26 November 2017. The purchaser is Okenos food.           
MD Number #822021311600009 showed that shrimps size 60 pieces/ kg, 4,800 Kg were harvested on 13 November 2017. The purchaser is Okenos food.           
MD Number #822021910600007showed that shrimps size 40 pieces/ kg, 6,000 Kg were harvested on 20 October 2017. The purchaser is Okenos food.           
MD Number #822011810600010 showed that shrimps size 73 pieces/ kg, 3,000 Kg were harvested on 19 October 2017. The purchaser is Okenos food. However, MD indicated FMD no.#839120106600001 . (This nonconformity is also related to 18.7)   
"
LongName: The facility shall keep complete and accurate records for each culture unit and production cycle, including the culture unit identification number, unit area and volume, species stocked and, if applicable, species specifications such as triploid or GMO.
Question: The facility shall keep complete and accurate records for each culture unit and production cycle, including the culture unit identification number, unit area and volume, species stocked and, if applicable, species specifications such as triploid or GMO.

AuditDetail:
There are total 24 land deeds (Nor Sor 3 Kor) for total 77.788 Ha.
From the copy of these land deeds, 14 land deeds indicated the owner
as Mr. Witthaya Suabbunjong, Mr. Wongrapong Suabbunjong, or Mr.
Somkid Suabbunjong while 9 land deeds indicated the owner as Ms.
Nongnapat Somboon. Another land deeds did not have the copy of the
current land deed owner and there are 2 versions of the land deed - the
first one as owner Ms. Saiyud Chanpitak for total areas 4.016 Ha while
the second one as owner Mr. Jamlong Chanpitak for area 2.008 Ha
which is sold to Ms. Nongnapat Somboon. There is a rental agreement
indicated that Ms. Nongnapat Somboon allowed Mr. Thanasit Noenchai
to rent total 77.788 Ha for 20 years starting from 3 March 2011.
However, there is no evident that the other owners (for those 14 land
deeds) allowed Ms. Nongnapat as their representative. Based on
discussion, all of the owners are the relatives to one another. For the
unclear land deeds (two versions), the auditor was informed that Ms.
Saiyud splitted the land to Mr. Jamlong and both lands were now sold
to Ms. Nongnapat; however, there is no evidence to support this
explanation due to the original land deeds are now kept in the bank as
mortgage.
Receipt of tax payment for land paid on 5 January 2018 and receipt of
tax payment for construction paid on 10 January 2018 were available
for review.
LongName: Current documents shall be available to prove legal land and water use by the applicant.
Question: Current documents shall be available to prove legal land and water use by the applicant.

AuditDetail:
During the facility tour, the auditor observed one unused door of the
feed storage areas are not fully sealed to prevent pests and there is a
small pile of dirt or animal dung near one pallet of feeds.
There are rodent traps (cages) with natural bait (such as pork or fruit)
installed on this farm and these traps were monitored daily, such
records are kept on file.
LongName: Measures shall be taken to prevent infestation by animal and insect vectors and pests.
Question: Measures shall be taken to prevent infestation by animal and insect vectors and pests.

AuditDetail:
Based on the reviewed records, there are no records about the used
pond additive chemicals for pond preparation and 2 ponds from 4
reviewed ponds.
LongName: Complete and accurate records shall be maintained on the use of sulfites or other approved food-processing aids/additives in shrimp, as well as the use of herbicides, algicides and other pesticides.
Question: Complete and accurate records shall be maintained on the use of sulfites or other approved food-processing aids/additives in shrimp, as well as the use of herbicides, algicides and other pesticides.

AuditDetail:
Based on the Thai Labor Law notification issue 8, effective date 1
January 2017, the minimum wage is 308 Thai Bahts (THB) per day (8
hours / day) for all types of employee in Rayong Province. During the
audit, the auditor reviewed the written contracts or payment records for
all workers who currently worked in this farm and found the minimum
salary is 9,150 THB which is 305 THB. Based on worker interview
about the payment, each worker got salary once a month and got extra
payment as percentage based on the sold price of harvested shrimps,
resulting the actual minimum salary is higher than the labor law per
crop. However, the farm cannot show the record for the extra payment
of the workers responsible for the traced lots (pond # B6 cultivated
during 10 January 2017 to 4 May 2017; # A2 cultivated during 10 July
2017 to 5 October 2017; and # B3 cultivated during 7 October 2017 to
18 December 2017), so the auditor cannot verify that each worker
really got the payment higher than the labor law. Only monthly salary
payment records in 2017 and 2018 (as minimum 9,150 THB) were
available for review.
The farm also provided free accommodation, free utilities (i.e. electricity
and fresh water), and free drinking water to each worker / family.
Due to the new Thai Labor Law notification issue 9 is effective on 1
April 2018, the minimum wage for Rayong province will be increased to
330 THB. Based on the discussion with the farm owner (Somboon's
family), they planned to increase the salary for each worker to be at
minimum 10,000 THB. However, this rate is not official announced to
the workers.
LongName: The applicant shall meet or exceed the minimum wage rate, benefits, required by local and national labor laws.
Question: The applicant shall meet or exceed the minimum wage rate, benefits, required by local and national labor laws.

AuditDetail: There are fire extinguishers available in most of risk areas and these fire extinguishers are checked once a month; however, during the site tour, the auditor found there is no fire extinguisher available near the intake water diesel pump areas. Material safety data sheets (MSDS) for all of chemicals and fuel that used in this farm are available. There is a sand bucket / sack available as absorbent at the electric generator areas, at the main diesel storage areas, and chemical storage areas. The workers were trained about chemical handling and usage on 20 February 2018 by the representative from Okeanos / Pakfood / TU Group. The workers were also trained about the BAP requirements on 20 February 2018.
LongName: Precautions shall be taken to prevent spills, fires and explosions, and procedures and supplies shall be readily available to manage chemical and fuel spills or leaks. Designated staff shall be trained to manage such spills and leaks.
Question: Precautions shall be taken to prevent spills, fires and explosions, and procedures and supplies shall be readily available to manage chemical and fuel spills or leaks.

AuditDetail:
During the facility tour, the auditor observed gap underneath the door of the feed storage areas. 
There are rodent traps (cages) with natural bait (such as fruit or meat) installed on this farm and these traps were monitored daily, such records are kept on file.
LongName: Measures shall be taken to prevent infestation by animal and insect vectors and pests.
Question: Measures shall be taken to prevent infestation by animal and insect vectors and pests.

AuditDetail:
Based on the reviewed records, there are no records about the used pond additive chemicals and/or pesticides for pond preparation. 

The pond additive chemicals used during the cultivation are normally recorded in the daily cultivation record.
LongName: Complete and accurate records shall be maintained on the use of sulfites or other approved food-processing aids/additives in shrimp, as well as the use of herbicides, algicides and other pesticides.
Question: Complete and accurate records shall be maintained on the use of sulfites or other approved food-processing aids/additives in shrimp, as well as the use of herbicides, algicides and other pesticides.

AuditDetail:
During the audit, the auditor randomly checked complete records for three success ponds as detailed in 18.2 and found FMD and COA (health certificate) for pond # A2 introduced on 10 July 2017 was missing. 
Aquatic Animal Fry Movement Document (FMD), Fry Field Performance (FFP) and/or Certificate of Analysis (COA) from the hatchery detail the sources and numbers of postlarvae. The records of daily cultivation activity details type, lot, and amount of feed and aquaculture substance used. The Aquatic Animal Movement Document (MD) detail quantity of shrimp, size of shrimp, and harvesting date. The FMD for the other 2 ponds indicated that the facility received / purchased post larvae - Litopenaeus vannamei from either CP hatchery - JR2 which is BAP certified hatchery - H10256 or CP hatchery / nursery - Laem Ngop which is non-BAP certified hatchery / nursery. Based on discussion, this farm purchased post larvae from several CP hatcheries such as JR 1, 2, 3 and Pathio which are BAP certified hatcheries, and Leam Ngob which is non-BAP certified hatchery.
LongName: The facility shall maintain complete and accurate records of the sources and numbers of postlarvae or fingerlings stocked, stocking dates and all feeds used for each culture unit.
Question: The facility shall maintain complete and accurate records of the sources and numbers of postlarvae or fingerlings stocked, stocking dates and all feeds used for each culture unit.

AuditDetail:
Work permit for 6 Laos workers were reviewed during the audit and the
auditor found 4 of them were indicated as workers for Rubber Tree
Plantation. Juree Farm Group owner (Somboon's family) explained to
the auditor that they have already discussed with the authority who
issued the work permit to reissue; however, the authority verbally said
they can used these cards together with the permit letter to recruit the
immigration workers. When the auditor reviewed the permit letter, it
indicated that Juree Farm Group got permission to recruit total 80
workers in order to work for plantation in Chanthaburi about 8 workers
and for shrimp farm in Chanthaburi about 72 workers. The letter
indicated the working place in Rayong province as well, but worker
request to work in Rayong province areas indicated as 0 workers.
Based on these documents, it seems the work permits for 4 Laos
workers who currently worked in Juree 31 are in doubt.
There are 10 workers in this farm (4 Thai workers and 6 Laos workers).
The copies of ID card for Thai workers and copies of work permits for
Laos workers were available for review.
LongName: The applicant shall only employee legally documented workers, whether nationals or migrants.
Question: The applicant shall only employee legally documented workers, whether nationals or migrants.

AuditDetail:
Aquaculture chemicals (e.g. Sodium Bicarbonate, Magnesium Sulfate, Seafresh, Hi power, Poly Aluminium Chloride (PAC), Calmac, K. Mag, Copper, Cymethrin, Betadine, Chlorine, Potassium Permanganate, Pond-plus, Pond-detox, and Trichlorfon) with clear identification / label for each chemical in both Thai and Laos are stored in chemical storage areas separated from feed and employee housing. Each chemicals and/or pesticides are properly stored separately in different rack or bund (secondary containment for liquid chemical) and in good order. During the facility tour, the auditor observed a hole on the wall of chemical storage which is part of the secondary containment for chlorine. 
Generally, fuel, lubricants, feed, and agricultural chemicals are identified, stored, used, and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner. For example, fuel is stored at the main fuel storage areas separately from feed storage and chemical storage areas. All empty containers for fuel, oil, and aquaculture chemicals are properly stored in specific storage and subjected to be removed by the chemical suppliers. Feed is kept in separated areas with screen around the areas.
LongName: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.
Question: Fuel, lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals shall be labeled, stored, used and disposed of in a safe and responsible manner.

AuditDetail:
The traceability record was detail from Aquatic Animal Fry Movement Document (FMD). The record of daily pond activity. The detail and record of feed and aquaculture substance used. The harvesting record and Aquatic Animal Movement Document (MD). The completed record of

Pond no. 3;1st crop, MD number #770011007590013, show that shrimp size 100 pieces/ kg, 12,000Kg were harvested on 10 July 2016, indicated FMD number #869023004590003 and the buyer is Xian-Ning seafood. However, Farm was not retain FMD.(This nonconformity is also related to 10.3 and 18.6 )
Pond no. 3; 2nd crop, FMD number #869020909590014, indicated that L. vannamei were bought from CP-Pathio hatchery. 
MD number #770011312590006, show that shrimp size 65 pieces/ kg, 25,000Kg were harvested on 13 December 2016, indicated FMD number #869020909590014 and the buyer is Xian-Ning seafood.
MD number #770013011590001, show that shrimp size 100 pieces/ kg, 4,200Kg were harvested on 30 November 2016, indicated FMD number #869020909590014 and the buyer is Xian-Ning seafood. were reviewed.

AuditDetail:
As verified in contract between hatchery and workers and interviewed worker, hatchery policy is in place to assure all works are voluntary; there is no sign of forced labour. Workers are not prohibited from leaving the hatchery after work.
However,dDuring audit was observed some non-conformity about work contract between hatchery and worker on point no. 4.5 as defined “cannot worked other placed in their day off or holiday”.
LongName: All work, including overtime, must be voluntary. The facility shall not engage in any form of forced or bonded labor. AuditDetail:
"Verified paid slip of Mr. Phigree, Mr. Afbus and Ms. Ar E Sao in July - September 2017 were satisfied with vacation, public holiday working day, holiday compensation  and etc. There was complied with thai labour law version 2541. 

However there was no evidence to present to auditor that employee was took their weekend, public holiday, vacation."
LongName: The applicant shall comply with national labor laws for pay, overtime and holiday compensation for hours worked beyond the regular work day or week.
Question: The applicant shall comply with national labor laws for pay, overtime and holiday compensation for hours worked beyond the regular work day or week.

AuditDetail:
Risk assessment on Worker health & safety were established and implemented. However, during audit  some non conformities were observed as below 

- Not include work at slope area at generator
- Not include the work in Nauplii and PLs production.

In case of incident from health and safety from workplace, safety officers and team were the person to investigation for cause of incident, found the correction for each incident, made the action plan to prevent the re-occur, then report to farm manager and Department of Labour protection and welfare. There was no accident from last 1 year.
LongName: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment.
Question: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment.

AuditDetail:
"Electrical pumps and aerators was according to standard safe and the machine design were properly and cover with protective guards. 

However, some equipment were unsafe of short-cut circuit as following
- The control box at intake pumping station was open with no locked and broken of push switch 
- There was no ground wire of old frozen cabinet."
LongName: Electrical pumps and aerators shall be wired according to standard safe procedures.
Question: Electrical pumps and aerators shall be wired according to standard safe procedures.

AuditDetail:
"Hatchery use sedimentation system to control sediment. The effluence water goto cement cannel, then pumped to aeration and sendimentation pond before discharge to nature body water. Effluence was clear during audit time.

However, during audit by interview there was no retention time for sediment because the water from Nauplii and PLs production activity were overflow 100 % directed to the sea. But the result of effluence was on BAP standard.  "

AuditDetail:
Fresh feeds used from an outside source as squid, and oster, krill, sand worm, artemia, micro algae produced in-house. However, there was no certificate from the supplier warranting that the frozen squid when fresh has not been treated with toxic preservatives such as formalin.

Training in First Aid Dt.12.04.2018, Personnel Hygiene Dt.26.04.2018

boats.

Water Analysis Report Dt.05.12.2017. However, no monitoring records

The facility using feed manufactured by Avanti Feeds Limited, Kovvur.

Almost all are stored products are labeled and used except a few

AuditDetail:
Level of water in neighboring wells is not effected adversely as no
concern was raised by any local community members. However, no
records were available for review.
LongName: Data on water levels in neighboring wells shall be requested from the well owners, and where available shall show that the water table is not adversely affected by the facility’s use of water for hatchery processes.
Question: Data on water levels in neighboring wells shall be requested from the well owners, and where available shall show that the water table is not adversely affected by the facility’s use of water for hatchery processes.

AuditDetail:
The facility is using live, fresh or frozen feed. The fresh feed is blood
worms supplied by Aqua Feedex, Chidambaram and frozen feed used
is squid supplied by Meesaiah Fisheries, Tuticorin . The fresh and
frozen feeds are used in maturation section and the declaration from
the supplier stating that the product was not treated with toxic
preservatives letter Dt.15.09.2017. However, no declaration from the
supplier stating that the product was not treated with toxic
preservatives for the fresh feed supplier Aqua Feedex.
LongName: Live, fresh or frozen feeds brought into the hatchery from an outside source shall be accompanied by a certificate from the supplier warranting that the feeds are fresh or were frozen when they were fresh, and have not been treated with toxic preservatives such as formalin.
Question: Live, fresh or frozen feeds brought into the hatchery from an outside source shall be accompanied by a certificate from the supplier warranting that the feeds are fresh or were frozen when they were fresh, and have not been treated with toxic preservative

AuditDetail:
All the screens were intact as observed during the facility tour and
effluent water is chlorinated before release. All screens were checked
for damage on daily basis documented in Screen Intact Verification
Record for Prevention of Escapes Dt.30.04.2018. However, the
effluent water is not monitored for the presence of live organisms.
LongName: All screens shall be well maintained and checked for damage at least daily and effluents shall be monitored for the presence of live organisms with records kept to demonstrate compliance.
Question: All screens shall be well maintained and checked for damage at least daily and effluents shall be monitored for the presence of live organisms with records kept to demonstrate compliance.

AuditDetail:
Proper grounding is observed for all the panel boards and general care
has been taken for electrical safety issues as observed during
inspection. Machinery is generally protected with proper drive belt
safety guards. However, at Pond No.2 of Zone A one of the long arm
aerator drive shaft was not protected and it is very close to the walk

AuditDetail: The applicant  meet the minimum wage rate, benefit according to the Andhra Pradesh state labour laws. Dt 28-09-2007 published in Gazette No 617 dated 26-10-2007 and wages linked at Variable Dearness Allowance of Rs 6.15 is available and verified. The facility has made a Wooden bridge at the pond which starts from pond embankment towards in the pond to check the feeding trays. However, the catwalk is very narrow in shape and farm did not provide any hand rail for worker’s safety.
LongName: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment. This included a requirement for accident investigation.
Question: The facility shall identify and eliminate or minimize any workplace health and safety hazards by conducting a thorough risk assessment. This included a requirement for accident investigation.

AuditDetail: Drinking water is available. Meals are brought by them for local people, person who are staying meals are prepared and as per the local eating customs. Dev: However, drinking water storage can was not safe for storing the water.
LongName: Safe drinking water shall be readily available to employees. If meals are provided, they shall be wholesome and commensurate with local eating customs.
Question: Safe drinking water shall be readily available to employees. If meals are provided, they shall be wholesome and commensurate with local eating customs.

AuditDetail: Electrical pumps and aerators are wired according to safety procedures also verified during audit. Machinery used have belt shaft and safety guards on them verified. Dev - However, in some motors in the farm electrical wires were not properly shielded and safety rubber mats were also not evident in the panel boards.
LongName: Electrical pumps and aerators shall be wired according to standard safe procedures. Machinery shall have proper driveshaft and/or drive belt safety guards.
Question: Electrical pumps and aerators shall be wired according to standard safe procedures. Machinery shall have proper driveshaft and/or drive belt safety guards.

AuditDetail: Fuel lubricants, feed and agricultural chemicals are not stored near feed, Employee housing or harvest equipment and supplies and verified storage area of the farm during audit. However, the feed bags were kept adjacent to the wall in the feed room.
LongName: Fuel, lubricants and agricultural chemicals shall not be stored near feed, in employee housing or kitchen areas, or near harvest equipment and supplies.
Question: Fuel, lubricants and agricultural chemicals shall not be stored near feed, in employee housing or kitchen areas, or near harvest equipment and supplies.

AuditDetail: Farm animals and domestic pets are not allowed to access production ponds. Dev: However, domestic pet found in the farm area, proper protection was not evident for the restriction of the animals.
LongName: Farm animals and domestic pets shall not be allowed to access production ponds.
Question: Farm animals and domestic pets shall not be allowed to access production ponds.

AuditDetail: The applicant  meet the minimum wage rate, benefit according to the Andhra Pradesh state labour laws. The minimum wages are for the period 01-04-2017 to 30-09-2017 from the Notification issued vide G O Ms No 93 LET&F (Lab II) Dept. Dt 28-09-2007 published in Gazette No 617 dated 26-10-2007 and wages linked at Variable Dearness Allowance of Rs 6.15 is available and verified. The current Cost Price Index (CPI) Points is 1225 points for which the gross salary for Mazdoor Working on land which is a lowest category of labor is Rs.7557.00/month. However, the benefits like PF, ESI are not evident during audit. The randomly verified salary for the Labor Suribabu is Rs 9840 for 24 days for the month of Mar 2017 which is higher than the state labor wages calculator available verified and recorded.
LongName: The applicant shall meet or exceed the minimum wage rate, benefits, required by local and national labor laws.
Question: The applicant shall meet or exceed the minimum wage rate, benefits, required by local and national labor laws.

AuditDetail: Training on General health, Personal hygiene on 20-02-2017, is provided to the workers. Safety and First Aid training on 06-02-2017, including chemical handling, contamination risk and waste disposal are available for the workers is available, verified and recorded. However, the trainer details do not match in the attendance of the trainees. Safety documents are available in local language for verification, however, the 4 no of illiterate workers, safety documents are not evident during audit. IOM farm training conducted together.
LongName: The applicant shall provide training in general health, personal hygiene and safety (including aquatic safety and the use of boats and associated equipment), first aid and contamination risks to all employees. Safety documents must be available in a language understood by the workforce.
Question: The applicant shall provide training in general health, personal hygiene and safety

AuditDetail: Farm has volume of water intake and use based on the volume of the water is available. No exchange is done in the farming. Effluents are only released during final harvests. However, the effluent monitoring as detailed in the implementation guidelines for all the effluents released is not evident during audit. The chlorides concentration do not correspond to the intake water salinity.

Question: Records on intake water and effluent monitoring shall be maintained and available, as detailed in the Implementation Guidelines.

AuditDetail: The applicant has neither got fish meal/fish oil from IFFO Rs- certified fishmeal or from approved improvers programs.
LongName: For fishmeal and fish oil derived from reduction fisheries, at least 50% shall come from sources that are either MSC- or IFFO RS-certified. LongName: Incoming ingredients shall be inspected, and tags or labels shall be checked for medications, trace minerals or other additives.
Question: Incoming ingredients shall be inspected, and tags or labels shall be checked for medications, trace minerals or other additives.

AuditDetail: Though there is a policy in place to prohibit refeeding of ingredients from like aquaculture organisms to prevent transmission of disease, The applicant uses Shrimp Head Meal, supplied by soniya fisheries maharastra Mumbai , as ingredient for shrimp feed. and it was verified in the formula and also there were in the warehouse.
LongName: The applicant shall respect prohibitions of the refeeding of ingredients from like aquaculture organisms to prevent transmission of disease.
Question: The applicant shall respect prohibitions of the refeeding of ingredients from like aquaculture organisms to prevent transmission of disease.

AuditDetail: Though the applicant has procedures Ref: Doc. No. SHOP6 dated 8.2.16 and maintains isolation between ingredients and ingredients and finished products, fish feed is stacked between the shrimp feed at finished feed warehouse. and also d the common fish feed functional feed is stacked between the PW vannamei feed. verified.
LongName: GMPs shall identify effective methods for maintaining isolation between different ingredients and between ingredients and finished products.
Question: GMPs shall identify effective methods for maintaining isolation between different ingredients and between ingredients and finished products.

AuditDetail: The GMPs identify how ingredients, feeds and feed contact surfaces are protected from adulteration with chemical and physical contaminants Ref: Doc. No. SHOP6 dated 8.2.16 Sec. 4.1 but many fishmeal and a few soyameal bags were damaged and kept exposed to surface contamination
LongName: GMPs shall identify how ingredients, feeds and feed contact surfaces are protected from adulteration with chemical and physical contaminants.
Question: GMPs shall identify how ingredients, feeds and feed contact surfaces are protected from adulteration with chemical and physical contaminants.

AuditDetail: Though the applicant has procedures and was able to demonstrate the implementation of GMPs that segregate processed feeds from unprocessed ingredients and misformulated, damaged, certain lot of fish meal is stocked at a reprocess material lot Ref: D13
LongName: The applicant shall be able to demonstrate the implementation of GMPs that segregate processed feeds from unprocessed ingredients and misformulated, damaged or returned feeds.
Question: The applicant shall be able to demonstrate the implementation of GMPs that segregate processed feeds from unprocessed ingredients and misformulated, damaged or returned feeds.

The facility has provided running water, toilets and hand washing
facilities to the employee however non of the area were provided with

documentation;

attendance sheet and also feedback for the training has been verified.

AuditDetail:

(SHOP 8 dt: 16.05.2018) that exclude animal pests using approved
pest control methods by licensed pest control service (license number:
33001225997 dt: 04.09.2015 issued by Department of Industries and
Commerce – Government of Tamil Nadu) Ref: M/s. Ranjitha
International Pour Chennai the contract doc. Dt: 01.01.2018 valid up to
31.12.2020. Rodent control Monitoring records R/SHOP/8 /1
dt:25.05.2018 , Fly Killers monitoring records R/SHOP 8 /2A ,B dt:
25.05.2018 were verified and inspected the facility result found
satisfactory During the site tour in the chemical storage area no 2
